perturbation.original_text: SHARED REVENUE: In lieu of PACIFICAP ENTERTAINMENT granting a 10 year Exclusive Content License to THE HENRY FILM AND ENTERTAINMENT CORPORATION, THE HENRY FILM ANDENTERTAINMENT CORPORATION agrees to share 10% of the net revenue from any and all advertising sales, Syndication Fees and Licensing fees generated from all television shows, DVD Magazines, Internet Streaming Video Television Shows, Television Shorts, Radio Shows, Radio Shorts, Cell Phone Video Clips, Caller ID Video Clips, Promotional Commercials, Websites, Streaming Video Commercials, Streaming Video Highlight Shows, 24 Hour Nostalgia Sports Network, DVD Program Package, Television Show Series, stock footage library, and print promotional posters, created and or produced with any content provided by PACIFICAP ENTERTAINMENT.
perturbation.changed_text: SHARED REVENUE: In lieu of PACIFICAP ENTERTAINMENT granting a Content License to THE HENRY FILM AND ENTERTAINMENT CORPORATION, THE HENRY FILM ANDENTERTAINMENT CORPORATION agrees to share a percentage of the net revenue from advertising sales, Syndication Fees and Licensing fees generated from content produced with content provided by PACIFICAP ENTERTAINMENT.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the specific 10% revenue share and the 10-year exclusive license, the modified text creates ambiguity about the actual percentage of revenue sharing and the exclusivity of the license. This omission contradicts the PERFORMANCE section, which still mentions a minimum annual payment seemingly tied to the original 10% figure, leading to uncertainty in enforcement. Also, it has been removed all the explicit content that is going to be produced and now it speaks more ambiguously about shared revenues.

perturbation.original_text: ALL DISPUTES ARISING OUT OF THIS AGREEMENT SHALL BE SETTLED VIA BINDING ARBITRATION ACCORDING TO THE RULES AND REGULATIONS SET FORTH BY THE AMERICAN ARBITRATION ASSOCIATION IN SAN DIEGO COUNTY , THE STATE OF CALIFORNIA.
perturbation.changed_text: ALL DISPUTES ARISING OUT OF THIS AGREEMENT SHALL BE SUBJECT TO MEDIATION.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the 'BINDING ARBITRATION' clause and specifying the 'AMERICAN ARBITRATION ASSOCIATION IN SAN DIEGO COUNTY , THE STATE OF CALIFORNIA' and instead specifying 'MEDIATION', it introduces an internal contradiction. The REMOVED clauses creates ambiguity as now mediation does not have a governing body or an specific place to be carried. This clause now means that the mediation could occur anywhere in the world and by any means the parties decide. This contradicts the intention of a binding agreement and leaves open questions about jurisdiction and enforceability.

perturbation.original_text:
"Advertising Rights" shall mean the advertising and promotional rights sold or licensed with respect to Content included properties.

"Affiliates" shall mean any company or any other entity worldwide, including, without limitation, corporations, partnerships, joint ventures, and Limited Liability Companies, in which THE HENRY FILM AND ENTERTAINMENT CORPORATION owns at least a five percent ownership, equity, or financial interest.

"THE HENRY FILM AND ENTERTAINMENT CORPORATION Brand Features" shall mean all trademarks, service marks, logos and other distinctive brand features of THE HENRY FILM AND ENTERTAINMENT CORPORATION that are used in or relate to a THE HENRY FILM AND ENTERTAINMENT CORPORATION Property or Content, including, without limitation, the trademarks, service marks and logos described.

"PACIFICAP ENTERTAINMENT Content" shall mean, collectively, all materials, data, and similar information collected and owned by PACIFICAP ENTERTAINMENT, which is a collection of television shows, clips, movies, recordings and photos.
perturbation.changed_text:
"Affiliates" shall mean any company or any other entity worldwide.

"PACIFICAP ENTERTAINMENT Content" shall mean all materials collected and owned by PACIFICAP ENTERTAINMENT.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the specific definitions for Advertising Rights and THE HENRY FILM AND ENTERTAINMENT CORPORATION Brand Features, it creates ambiguity about the extent of rights granted and the protections afforded to THE HENRY FILM AND ENTERTAINMENT CORPORATION's brand. This omission introduces uncertainty in interpreting clauses that reference these terms (such as the indemnification clause regarding brand features) and could lead to disputes regarding advertising usage and brand infringement. Modifying also the meaning of the definition of PACIFICAP ENTERTAINMENT Content, now it could include many other things than a collection of television shows, clips, movies, recordings and photos.
